channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: "It Was My Great Honour To Destroy All Iranian Nuclear Facilities.": Trump

media:content.media:description: In a post on Truth Social, Trump noted that both Israel and Iran "equally" wanted the conflict to end.

item.description: Trump on Tuesday expressed his satisfaction in stopping "THE WAR" between Iran and Israel, asserting that it was his "great honour" to destroy all of Iran's nuclear facilities and capabilities before brokering a ceasefire between the two nations.
item.content:encoded: Trump on Tuesday expressed his satisfaction in stopping "THE WAR" between Iran and Israel, asserting that it was his "great honour" to destroy all of Iran's nuclear facilities and capabilities before brokering a ceasefire between the two nations.

item.title: Hearing In Sheikh Hasina's Crimes Against Humanity Case On July 1

media:content.media:description: Sheikh Hasina was accused of mass killings during the uprising in June 2024.

item.description: The indictment hearing in the crimes against humanity case against Bangladesh's deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been set for July 1, the country's crimes tribunal announced on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: The indictment hearing in the crimes against humanity case against Bangladesh's deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been set for July 1, the country's crimes tribunal announced on Tuesday.

item.title: US Strikes On Iran Did Not Destroy Nuclear Sites: Report
item.description: An early US intelligence assessment indicated that the US military strikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities last week did not destroy the core components of Tehran's nuclear program and likely only set it back by months, CNN reported on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: An early US intelligence assessment indicated that the US military strikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities last week did not destroy the core components of Tehran's nuclear program and likely only set it back by months, CNN reported on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump Tells Congress Iran Had Nuclear Weapons Program, Contradicting US Spy Agencies

media:content.media:description: Trump first cast doubt on intelligence about Iran's nuclear program last week.

item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump told Congress this week that the Iranian sites bombed by the U.S. housed a "nuclear weapons development program," even though U.S. spy agencies have said no such program existed.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump told Congress this week that the Iranian sites bombed by the U.S. housed a "nuclear weapons development program," even though U.S. spy agencies have said no such program existed.

item.title: Netanyahu Vows To Thwart "Any Attempt" By Iran To Rebuild Nuclear Programme

media:content.media:description: "Iran will not have a nuclear weapon," Netanyahu said.

item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared a "historic victory" on Tuesday after agreeing a ceasefire with Iran and insisted that his country's arch-foe would never achieve a nuclear weapon.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared a "historic victory" on Tuesday after agreeing a ceasefire with Iran and insisted that his country's arch-foe would never achieve a nuclear weapon.

item.title: Netanyahu Hails Historic Win, Commits To Campaign Against Iran Axis, Hamas
item.description: PM Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel had achieved a historic victory that would stand for generations, but it must complete its campaign against Iran's axis, defeat Hamas and bring about the return of all the hostages in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: PM Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel had achieved a historic victory that would stand for generations, but it must complete its campaign against Iran's axis, defeat Hamas and bring about the return of all the hostages in Gaza.

item.title: Crime, Terror, Rape: United States Flags India Travel Risks

media:content.media:description: The US has issued a Level 2 travel advisory for American nationals living in or traveling to India

item.description: Officials in the Trump administration have also recommended that women avoid traveling alone and stay alert, especially at tourist destinations and public spaces.
item.content:encoded: Officials in the Trump administration have also recommended that women avoid traveling alone and stay alert, especially at tourist destinations and public spaces.

item.title: In A Surprise Announcement, Trump Asks China To 'Keep Buying Oil From Iran'

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump announced that "China can now continue to purchase Oil from Iran." (File)

item.description: In a sudden twist in Washington's Iran policy, US President Donald Trump made an unexpected announcement shortly after declaring a ceasefire between Iran and Israel after nearly two weeks of air strikes and missile attacks.
item.content:encoded: In a sudden twist in Washington's Iran policy, US President Donald Trump made an unexpected announcement shortly after declaring a ceasefire between Iran and Israel after nearly two weeks of air strikes and missile attacks.

item.title: Russia Welcomes Iran-Israel Ceasefire, Hopes It Will Last

media:content.media:description: Russia has expressed support for Iran but without elaborating on things like ways to help or condemning.

item.description: Russia said on Tuesday that it would welcome a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, after both sides and US President Donald Trump announced a halt in hostilities.
item.content:encoded: Russia said on Tuesday that it would welcome a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, after both sides and US President Donald Trump announced a halt in hostilities.

item.title: Qatar PM Persuaded Iran To Accept Ceasefire: Report

media:content.media:description: Qatari Prime Minister persuaded Iran to accept ceasefire: Source

item.description: Qatar's prime minister persuaded Iran to agree to a US-proposed ceasefire with Israel after Tehran fired missiles at an American base near Doha, a source with knowledge of the talks said on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: Qatar's prime minister persuaded Iran to agree to a US-proposed ceasefire with Israel after Tehran fired missiles at an American base near Doha, a source with knowledge of the talks said on Tuesday.

item.title: UN Condemns "Weaponisation Of Food" In Gaza

media:content.media:description: Head of the UN agency has called the Israel backed food distribution system in Gaza an "abomination".

item.description: The United Nations on Tuesday condemned what it said was Israel's "weaponisation of food" in Gaza and called it a war crime, urging its military to "stop shooting at people trying to get food".
item.content:encoded: The United Nations on Tuesday condemned what it said was Israel's "weaponisation of food" in Gaza and called it a war crime, urging its military to "stop shooting at people trying to get food".

item.title: 2.5 Million Refugees Face Uncertainty As Global Resettlement Access Shrinks

media:content.media:description: Last year UNHCR supported the resettlement of 116,000 refugees globally.

item.description: An estimated 2.5 million refugees worldwide will need to be resettled next year, the UN said Tuesday, at a time when the United States but also other nations are shrinking resettlement access.
item.content:encoded: An estimated 2.5 million refugees worldwide will need to be resettled next year, the UN said Tuesday, at a time when the United States but also other nations are shrinking resettlement access.

item.title: "Thank You For Decisive Action In Iran": NATO Chief's Pre-Summit Note To Trump

media:content.media:description: NATO leaders are set to sign up a pledge to spend 5 % of GDP on defence.

item.description: "Truly extraordinary": NATO boss Mark Rutte Tuesday sent a gushing, caps-filled, pre-summit note to Donald Trump Tuesday, showing how far he goes to flatter the mercurial US president, who promptly posted the missive online.
item.content:encoded: "Truly extraordinary": NATO boss Mark Rutte Tuesday sent a gushing, caps-filled, pre-summit note to Donald Trump Tuesday, showing how far he goes to flatter the mercurial US president, who promptly posted the missive online.

item.title: UN Rights Chief Urges Sri Lanka To Ensure Accountability For Wartime Atrocities

media:content.media:description: UNHR chief said Sri Lanka must address the question of impunity during the Tamil separatist war.

item.description: The United Nations human rights chief urged Sri Lanka on Tuesday to ensure accountability for crimes committed during its protracted ethnic war.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations human rights chief urged Sri Lanka on Tuesday to ensure accountability for crimes committed during its protracted ethnic war.

item.title: UK Government Says Chinese Spying On The Rise, Pledges $818 Million To Intelligence

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer commissioned an "audit" of Britain's relations with Beijing.

item.description: Chinese spying and attempts by Beijing to undermine Britain's democracy and economy have risen in recent years, the UK government said Tuesday in a report on the Asian giant.
item.content:encoded: Chinese spying and attempts by Beijing to undermine Britain's democracy and economy have risen in recent years, the UK government said Tuesday in a report on the Asian giant.

item.title: Iran Says Not Seeking Nuclear Weapons But Will Assert 'Legitimate Rights'

media:content.media:description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said his country was not seeking nuclear weapons.

item.description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that his country was not seeking nuclear weapons but would continue to defend its "legitimate rights" in the peaceful use of nuclear energy.
item.content:encoded: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that his country was not seeking nuclear weapons but would continue to defend its "legitimate rights" in the peaceful use of nuclear energy.

item.title: Trump Says Doesn't Want 'Regime Change' In Iran, Cites Risk of Chaos

media:content.media:description: Trump told reporters regime change brings chaos and ideally we don't want that.

item.description: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he didn't want to see "regime change" in Iran amid its conflict with Israel, adding that it would cause "chaos."
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he didn't want to see "regime change" in Iran amid its conflict with Israel, adding that it would cause "chaos."

item.title: Woman Claims She Was Attacked By 'Devil's Breath' On London Underground
item.description: The woman claimed that she was attacked with a memory-erasing drug while she was travelling on the London Underground.
item.content:encoded: The woman claimed that she was attacked with a memory-erasing drug while she was travelling on the London Underground.

item.title: What Ancient Ice Sheets Can Tell Us About Future Sea Level Rise

media:content.media:description: When ice gets trapped on land as giant ice sheets, it causes the sea level to change. (Representational)

item.description: When visiting Godrevy beach on the north Cornish coast, most people look out to sea at the lighthouse, surfers and seals rather than the cliffs behind.
item.content:encoded: When visiting Godrevy beach on the north Cornish coast, most people look out to sea at the lighthouse, surfers and seals rather than the cliffs behind.

item.title: How The End Of Carbon Capture Could Spark A New Industrial Revolution

media:content.media:description: Heavy industry is widely viewed as the toughest part of the economy to clean up. (Representative)

item.description: The U.S. Department of Energy's decision to claw back US$3.7 billion in grants from industrial demonstration projects may create an unexpected opening for American manufacturing.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Department of Energy's decision to claw back US$3.7 billion in grants from industrial demonstration projects may create an unexpected opening for American manufacturing.
